quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to add an audio element:
[!raw!]
<{0} controls>
<source {1}="test.ogg"
    type="audio/ogg" >
</audio>
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Audio on the Web[/h1]

Before HTML5, there was no standard for playing audio files on a web page.
The HTML5 <audio> element specifies a standard for embedding audio in a web page.

There are two different ways to specify the audio source file's URL. The first uses the source attribute: [code format="html" codeId="40"]<[b]audio[/b] src="audio.mp3" controls>
   Audio element not supported by your browser
</[b]audio[/b]>[/code]
The second way uses the <source> element inside the <audio> element: [code format="html" codeId="41"][b]<audio controls>[/b]
   <source src="audio.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
   <source src="audio.ogg" type="audio/ogg">
[b]</audio>[/b][/code]
[note]Multiple <source> elements can be linked to different audio files. The browser will use the first recognized format.[/note]

quizzes.question: The text in between the audio tags is:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Audio on the Web [/h1]

 The <audio> element creates an audio player inside the browser. [code format="html" codeId="42"]<audio controls>
   <source src="audio.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
   <source src="audio.ogg" type="audio/ogg">
   Audio element not supported by your browser. 
</audio>[/code]
[b]Result: [/b][img id="2547" width="100%"]
[note]The text between the <audio> and </audio> tags will display in browsers that do not support the <audio> element.[/note]

quizzes.question: Which of the following is not an attribute of the audio element?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Attributes of <audio> [/h1]

[b]controls[/b]
Specifies that audio controls should be displayed (such as a play/pause button, etc.)

[b]autoplay[/b]
When this attribute is defined, audio starts playing as soon as it is ready, without asking for the visitor's permission. [code format="html" codeId="43"]<audio controls [b]autoplay[/b]>[/code]
[b]loop[/b]
This attribute is used to have the audio replay every time it is finished. [code format="html" codeId="44"]<audio controls autoplay [b]loop[/b]>[/code]
[note]Currently, there are three supported file formats for the <audio> element: MP3, WAV, and OGG.[/note]
